snippet: The Egyptian opposition signaled that it had given up hope of defeating the draft constitution at the polls and would opt instead to try to undermine the referendum’s legitimacy.
abstract: Political crisis over Egypt’s draft constitution hardens, with Pres Mohamed Morsi preparing to deploy military to safeguard balloting in a planned referendum on the new charter and opponents calling for more protests and a boycott to undermine the vote; decision to boycott signals that opposition believes it cannot defeat the draft charter at the polls, and has opted instead to try to undermine the referendum’s legitimacy.

byline.contributor: Michael Schwirtz contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The Egyptian opposition signaled that it had given up hope of defeating the draft constitution at the polls and would opt instead to try to undermine the referendum’s legitimacy.

headline.seo: Morsi’s Concessions Fail to Quiet Egyptian Opponents
headline.main: Opponents of Egypt’s Leader Call for Boycott of Charter Vote
headline.print_headline: Egypt Opposition Seeking Boycott Of Charter Vote

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
